metadata.Title: CVE-2016-0495 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Unspecified vulnerability in the Oracle VM VirtualBox component in Oracle Virtualization VirtualBox before 4.3.36 and 5.0.14 allows remote attackers to affect availability via unknown vectors related to Core.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-0495` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

virtualbox - 5.0.14-dfsg-2
virtualbox-dkms - 5.0.14-dfsg-2
virtualbox-guest-dkms - 5.0.14-dfsg-2
virtualbox-guest-source - 5.0.14-dfsg-2
virtualbox-guest-utils - 5.0.14-dfsg-2
virtualbox-guest-x11 - 5.0.14-dfsg-2
virtualbox-qt - 5.0.14-dfsg-2
virtualbox-source - 5.0.14-dfsg-2
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> "VirtualBox prior to 4.3.36, prior to 5.0.14" sbeattie> likely not-affected for precise, not listed in matrix for this CVE

criterions.comment: virtualbox package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.0.14-dfsg-2').
